pages.text: Modular boats can have up to 4 different module types at once.

pages.title: Engine Spot
pages.text: $(thing)Engine modules$() are used to move the boat. The speed of the boat can be adjusted, by either underclocking or overclocking the engine.$(br)Increasing the speed also increases the rate at which items are consumed, and lowering the speed reduces this rate.

pages.title: Storage Spot
pages.text: $(thing)Storage modules$() can store items, energy, fluids or players.$(br)Some modules require a storage module to be attached in order to work (for example, the $(l:modules/fishing)Fishing module$()).$(br2)When the boat is destroyed, the items inside the module will spawn.

pages.title: Navigation Spot
pages.text: $(thing)Navigation modules$() are used to help the boat navigate. $(l:modules/spots#engine)Engines$() only push the boat forward but do not make the boat turn. Navigation modules are therefore useful for orienting the boat towards a destination.

pages.title: Miscellaneous Spot
pages.text: $(thing)Miscellaneous modules$() are various modules that do not fit in the other categories, and are mostly utility modules.
